Guard Dog

Row 1 title

Special: 180° senses

Special: 180° senses

Guard dogs can become alert of The Marked Ninja’s presence, even when they are hiding behind cover (i.e: vents, dumpsters, doors, etc).

Row 2 title

Special: Cannot be terrorized by normal means

Special: Cannot be terrorized by normal means

Guard dogs cannot be terrorized by the discovery of a hanging guard, nor can they be terrorized among any means of The Path of Nightmares. The only way a guard dog can be terrorized is by attacking it with a terror dart (Note: The upgraded terror dart will still kill the guard dog after the duration has passed. The guard dog will spontaneously bleed rather than committing suicide with a gun… for many obvious reasons).

Row 3 title

Weakness: Cannot open doors

Weakness: Cannot open doors

Guard dogs cannot open doors on their own; They must be assisted by a human. Otherwise, they can only scratch at the door whilst barking. (Poor thing)

Row 4 title

Weakness: Limited Alerts

Weakness: Limited Alerts

Guard dogs are (debatably) less likely to alert other guards, as the guard dog can only bark (which alerts guards in a limited radius) rather than shooting at The Marked Ninja (which alerts any guard in the same room or in adjacent rooms). Note: Guard dogs still, however, count against alarms if they are alarmed (witnessing or sniffing out The Marked Ninja).

Row 5 title

Weakness: Cannot check vents

Weakness: Cannot check vents

Guard dogs cannot check vents, as opposed to humans, who can peek into the vents to see if The Marked Ninja is in the vent.

Row 6 title

Weakness: No flashlight

Weakness: No flashlight

Guard dogs are not armed with flashlights, making it nearly impossible to spot The Marked Ninja from far distances while the guard dog is alert.
